reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cant wait to read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots of statistics from a readers point of view
reviews.reviewText: Clearly eye opening in terms of present day finance capital movement, great emphasis was placed on industrization however little mention of influencers such as A. Carnegie or J Pierpont morgan, a bit centralized as government systems seemed curtained by big industries, All in all imperialism is ultra privatization of globalized capital hence monopolies, trusts an cartels being formed. P.s is it grow or grew? #V.I.Lenin

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great book
reviews.reviewText: This is a great read the book is mid-1800 about how big companies became monopolies by legal and illegal paths they started to acquire a variety of productive and commercial branches, which eventually will acquire not only every branch of production but all the sectors that were related to it, from the production of raw materials to transportation and marketing. They were conglomerates that Lenin called the Trust. Similar to what Amazon and Facebook(Meta) do acquire any competitive market and consolidate a whole industry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: going to wage war on imperialists

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars To know how the European banks financed the exploitation of African and Latin America.
reviews.reviewText: So this is how Britain, France, and the other European imperialists financed their exploitative operations in Africa and Latin America.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An informative read and relevant to today despite its year of publication
reviews.reviewText: •Monopoly seems to be inevitable.•Labor unions need to be formed everywhere possible and special care should be taken to keep their leaders from being corrupted.•Financial predation seems to be characteristic of capitalism, which really appears to be more imperialist than anything.For more visual information on how banks and other financial institutions more or less own everything, look for the 13F reports of JPMORGAN, Bank of America, Citigroup, BlackRock, Vanguard, Ensign Peak Advisors, and moreA dense read, but Lenin did a good job getting his point across.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lenin writing 2 years before the Russian revolution
reviews.reviewText: A lot of numbers but fascinating nonetheless.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful book, but contents aside the book is well put together and sold at a great price. Very few printing errors, a few letters were missing part of the letter but not so severe that your mind cannot fill in the blanks. I would very much recommend this book to anyone interested in political and/or economic theory.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reading the book really makes everything so damn clear
reviews.reviewText: ... to the point where observing the world in the 21st century makes you way too depressed. Makes you contemplate as to how the working class even allowed the finance capital dominate every aspect of their lives. And with this contemplation the book provides an answer "As to avoid a civil war between the ruling class and working class; Imperialism is necessary". That was a quote given by a bourgeoisie friendly author in the 20th century in defense of Imperialism without realizing that he indiscriminately supports the class differences between bourgeoisie and proletariat. What a bizzare and delusional world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I started having interest in communism just recently, and I thank the opportunity to be able to read such book.

This book is fantastic, whether you're communist or not. This is extremely educational on imperialism (and capitalism). His predictions from 100 years ago are unbelievably accurate. This book is quite a difficult read if you're not up to date with all of your economic and political terminology so it might be handy to have a dictionary by your side.

Lenin is a genius, give him a chance! the book is such a good read, whether you're communist or not. It provides a clear explanation of on imperialism (and capitalism). Lenin Predicted things like the IMF and world bank.
